p: In Table 2, the world is divided in five blocks. CAIT standardly provides a division into the eight geographical regions, Asia (AS), Europe (EUR), Middle East and North Africa (ME), sub-Saharan Africa (AFR), North America (NA), Central America and Caribbean (CAM), South America (SAM), and Oceania (OC). In Table 2, ME and AFR are merged into AF, CAM, and SAM into SA and OC and EUR into EU. In this division, two are rich (North America and Europe with Oceania) and two are poor (Asia and Africa), with Central and South America in between.
